results.title: The Inner planets
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Media Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Uses special effects to create an impression of what is known of the structural character of the inner planets - Mercury, Venus and Mars. explains why life cannot be sustained on these planets. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Inner mind of Milton Whitty
results.creator_credit: Peter Alford, Don Haldane, Lee Gordon and Westminster Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Safety”.
Deals with the fundamental question - “Whose responsibility is safety?” Asked to prepare a speech on safety, Whitty is forced to take a candid look at his performance in accident prevention. In a dream sequence, he is brought to trial and his jury and witnesses are from work and home. This fantasy provides for some statements which will find their application in the safety experience of most companies.

results.title: The Inner man steps out
results.creator_credit: Pathescope Company of America, Henry Strauss and Robert Wilmot
results.brief_description: A supervisor who knows the “book rules” for human relations finds himself in trouble when trying to apply them to people on the job. Points out the things a man with supervisory responsibility needs to know about the way different people react to different situations, and the use he can make of this knowledge to improve his own job function and that of the people he supervises.

results.title: The Inn of the sixth happiness
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Buddy Adler and Mark Robson
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “The Small woman” by Alan Burgess this is the true story of Gladys Aylward, an English woman who went to China as a missionary in the 1900s. The film captures her involvement in the lives of the people of Yengcheng during the violent and turbulent times leading up to the Japanese invasion. Cast includes Ingrid Bergman, Curt Jurgens, Robert Donat, Richard Wattis. Nominated for an Academy Award, Best Director.

results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions and Japan. National Tourist Organisation

results.title: The Initial interview
results.brief_description: A marriage counselling session is presented, showing the initial interview. Afterwards a class of marriage counsellors are taught by flashbacks highlighting important moments of the interview. Role playing is introduced to mitigate the problems and fears of counsellors; interaction promotes emotional involvement of student counsellors.

results.title: The Inheritance
results.brief_description: An authentic history of America from the view point of its working people, from the early 1900’s. Shows how the first unions sprang from bitter disillusionment and traces the history of the people against the background of World War 1, the Twenties, the Depression, the Roosevelt era, and the present day struggles for civil rights. Narrated by Robert Ryan.

results.title: The Inhabited man
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Peter Dimond and John Dick
results.brief_description: A talking flea makes a young man aware that he has scabies though he could have countless other organisms living on his body. Anxious, the young man visits a doctor who explains to him that whilst complete prevention is not yet possible, sound personal hygiene can cut down on the incidence of scabies.

results.title: The Ingrate
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: A young bank clerk’s love for the daughter of the bank’s president proves to be a dilemma which eventually turns into a disaster for one and all. Cast includes Herbert Yost, Florence Lawrence, Arthur V. Johnson.

results.title: The Ingot
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Film Producers Guild, Frank A. Hoare and John Durst
results.brief_description: More than 97% of the steel produced in Britain is cast into ingots. The different methods of teeming molten steel into ingot moulds are shown in this film, which also illustrates with sectional diagrams the difference between the main types of ingot and explains the purpose for which each type is generally used.
